metadata.subject: The most important energy developments of 2012: how countries are planning for Independence Day

organizations: Strategic Studies Institute of the U.S. Army

relationships.description: Cembalest conducts annual energy discussions with Smil for J.P. Morgan reports
Extensive economic, political and military cooperation including energy partnerships
Germany facing financial commitments to bail out European periphery while pursuing expensive energy transition

transactions: Federal grants to Fisker and A123 Systems

analysis.purpose: To provide market commentary on global energy developments and their economic implications
analysis.significance: Comprehensive analysis of global energy trends with specific focus on US energy independence, German renewable transition, Japan's post-Fukushima dilemma, China-Iran relations, and electric vehicle challenges

notable_quotes: "The shale/tight oil boom in the United States is not a temporary bubble, but the most important revolution in the oil sector in decades."
"It is beneficial for our external environment to have the United States militarily and diplomatically deeply sunk in the Mideast to the extent that it can hardly extricate itself"
"the 'entire green thing is desirable and very much worth doing, but at a measured realistic pace commensurate with overall system conditions and requirements"
red_flags: High cost estimates for renewable energy transitions
Electric vehicle industry failures despite government funding

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this analytical market commentary

illegal_activity.description: Document is analytical market commentary with no illegal activity discussed

public_knowledge.context: Energy policy analysis and market commentary from major financial institution

analysis.summary: This J.P. Morgan Asset Management report analyzes global energy developments in 2012, focusing on US energy independence prospects, Germany's expensive renewable energy transition, Japan's post-Fukushima energy dilemma, China's growing energy needs and relationship with Iran, and continued challenges facing electric vehicle adoption.
